projects.title: DevAlign
projects.description: DevAlign is an AI-powered Human Resource Information System (HRIS) specifically designed to revolutionize IT project allocation in Indonesia's software industry. Built to address the critical challenge of high employee turnover (20-35% annually) caused by skill-role mismatches, DevAlign leverages artificial intelligence and data analytics to match the right people with the right projects.

pages.heading: Project Overview
pages.text: DevAlign is an AI-driven Human Resource Information System (HRIS) built to transform how IT projects are staffed within Indonesia’s software industry. Addressing the industry’s high annual turnover rate of 20–35%, largely driven by mismatches between employee skills and project requirements, DevAlign uses advanced AI and data analytics to ensure the right talent is placed on the right projects. The result is smarter allocation, stronger team performance, and a more sustainable workforce.

pages.heading: The Challenge
pages.text: The wrong people are too often placed on the wrong projects, creating misalignment, stalled progress, and unnecessary frustration across teams.
list: Misaligned Skills and Roles – Employees are assigned to projects that don’t match their true capabilities.
Inefficient Use of Talent – Resources are spread thin or underutilized due to guesswork-based allocation.
Increased Turnover & Costs – Poor project fit leads to disengagement, burnout, and higher replacement expenses.

pages.heading: The Solution
pages.text: We introduced an AI-powered HRIS that intelligently matches people to projects based on real data—skills, experience, certifications, and workload—ensuring every assignment is a strategic fit.
list: AI-Generated Employee Profiles – Automatically track skills, tech stacks, certifications, achievements, and experience history.
Smart Project Matching Engine – Recommends or auto-assigns employees to projects using skill compatibility, availability, and workload balance.
Integrated Workflow Tools – Kanban boards and collaboration features streamline task visibility and team coordination.

contributions.label: Frontend
tasks: Built UI components
Integrated GraphQL

contributions.label: Backend
tasks: Designed DB model
Created REST/GraphQL API

pages.heading: Expected Impact
grid: Increased project success rates through optimal skill–project matching
Higher employee satisfaction and reduced turnover
More efficient utilization of talent and time

pages.heading: DevAlign Project

projects.title: Dungeon and Dragons adventure
projects.description: Dungeon and Dragons adventure is an online multiplayer D&D-style game where players create characters, join campaigns, and interact with an AI-powered Dungeon Master. Built with Next.js, Socket.IO, PostgreSQL, and Drizzle ORM, it delivers dynamic storytelling and synchronized real-time gameplay, with scalable deployment supported by Docker.

pages.heading: Project Overview
pages.text: Dungeon and Dragons Adventure is an online multiplayer D&D-style game where players create characters, join campaigns, and interact with an AI-powered Dungeon Master. Built with Next.js, Socket.IO, PostgreSQL, and Drizzle ORM, it delivers dynamic storytelling and synchronized real-time gameplay, with scalable deployment supported by Docker.

contributions.label: Frontend
tasks: Built UI components
Integrated GraphQL

contributions.label: Backend
tasks: Designed DB model
Created REST/GraphQL API

pages.heading: Key Features
list: AI-powered Dungeon Master for dynamic storytelling
Real-time multiplayer powered by Socket.IO
Custom character creation with classes, races, and abilities
Persistent campaign data stored in PostgreSQL
Dice-roll simulation and combat encounter system
Next.js modern interface with responsive design
Docker-based scalable server deployment
Party matchmaking and session management

projects.title: TixPlaza
projects.description: TixPlaza is an online ticket booking platform that allows users to browse, select, and purchase tickets for various events such as concerts, sports, and theater performances. Built with Nuxt.js, and MySql, TixPlaza offers a seamless user experience with real-time seat selection, secure payment processing, and personalized event recommendations.

pages.heading: Overview
pages.text: TixPlaza is an online ticket booking platform that allows users to browse, select, and purchase tickets for various events such as concerts, sports, and theater performances. Built with Nuxt.js, and MySql, TixPlaza offers a seamless user experience with real-time seat selection, secure payment processing, and personalized event recommendations.

contributions.label: Frontend
tasks: Developed responsive UI components using Nuxt.js and TailwindCSS
Implemented real-time seat selection interface with dynamic state updates
Integrated event browsing, filtering, and detailed event pages
Built user authentication flows and protected routes
Connected frontend pages with backend APIs using async data fetching
Created intuitive checkout flow with error handling and UX optimizations

contributions.label: Backend
tasks: Designed and structured the database schema using Prisma and MySQL
Implemented REST APIs for events, seats, bookings, and users
Integrated secure payment processing using Xendit
Developed real-time seat locking logic to prevent overbooking
Handled file storage for event banners and assets using Minio
Containerized the backend environment using Docker for consistent deployment

pages.heading: Key Features
list: Real-time seat selection with live availability updates
Secure online payment processing with multiple payment methods
Personalized event recommendations powered by user preferences
Advanced search and filtering for concerts, sports, and theater events
User-friendly Nuxt.js interface with fast and responsive performance
Order history and e-ticket management for seamless user access
Admin dashboard for event management, pricing, and ticket inventory
MySQL-backed data storage ensuring reliability and scalability

pages.heading: TixPlaza
pages.text: Here are final UI designs and previews.

projects.title: Moo Nonton
projects.description: Moo Nonton is a simple movie streaming website built as a practice project to revisit the fundamentals of front-end development. After frequently relying on TailwindCSS, this project was intentionally created to relearn and strengthen core CSS skills. Developed using React.js and vanilla CSS, it features movie listings from various genres and includes a wishlist system managed with Redux. This project was completed as part of the Web Development course at the Korean ASEAN Digital Academy.

pages.heading: Project Overview
pages.text: Moo Nonton is a simple movie streaming website built as a practice project to revisit the fundamentals of front-end development. After frequently relying on TailwindCSS, this project was intentionally created to relearn and strengthen core CSS skills. Developed using React.js and vanilla CSS, it features movie listings from various genres and includes a wishlist system managed with Redux. This project was completed as part of the Web Development course at the Korean ASEAN Digital Academy.

contributions.label: Frontend
tasks: Built the entire user interface using React and Vanilla CSS to reinforce core styling fundamentals
Implemented page layouts and component structures without relying on utility frameworks
Managed global state with Redux to handle user wishlist and movie selections
Integrated movie data fetching and displayed genre-based movie lists
Added interactive features such as wishlist toggling and movie detail views
Optimized UI behavior and component rendering for a smooth browsing experience

pages.heading: Key Features
list: Movie browsing with genre-based filtering
Responsive UI built entirely with vanilla CSS
User wishlist system powered by Redux
Movie detail page with synopsis and metadata
Search functionality for quick movie discovery
Lightweight and fast front-end built with React
Clean and beginner-friendly interface layout

pages.heading: Moo Nonton
pages.text: Here are final UI designs and previews.

projects.title: Math 4 Dumb
projects.description: This web aims to help students from elementary school to high school in learning math easily and fun. Because, on this web the material will be presented interactively and students can create discussion threads when facing difficult material so that it can be answered by other users. This web is built with Vue.js and Tailwind for the front-end. Then, using Express.js as a backend endpoint and MySql for database storage where storage includes account storage, material bookmarks, and discussion posts. And account security has also used Bcrypt, JWT, and Cookies.

pages.heading: Project Overview
pages.text: This web aims to help students from elementary school to high school in learning math easily and fun. Because, on this web the material will be presented interactively and students can create discussion threads when facing difficult material so that it can be answered by other users. This web is built with Vue.js and Tailwind for the front-end. Then, using Express.js as a backend endpoint and MySql for database storage where storage includes account storage, material bookmarks, and discussion posts. And account security has also used Bcrypt, JWT, and Cookies.

contributions.label: Frontend
tasks: Developed the user interface using Vue.js with a responsive layout styled in TailwindCSS
Implemented interactive math learning modules and dynamic content rendering
Built discussion thread pages with real-time updates using Vue reactivity
Created bookmark functionality for users to save learning materials
Integrated frontend components with backend APIs for authentication, materials, and discussion posts
Handled client-side validation, error handling, and smooth user navigation

contributions.label: Backend
tasks: Designed and structured MySQL database schema for users, materials, bookmarks, and discussion posts
Developed RESTful API endpoints using Express.js for authentication and content management
Implemented secure user authentication using Bcrypt for hashing and JWT + cookies for session management
Created API logic for discussion threads, including posting, replying, and fetching discussions
Built CRUD operations for learning materials and bookmark features
Ensured backend data validation, error handling, and role-based access protections

pages.heading: Key Features
list: Interactive math learning modules for elementary to high school students
Discussion forum for students to ask questions and help each other
Bookmark system for saving important materials to review later
User authentication with secure login and role-based access
Responsive and clean interface built with Vue.js and TailwindCSS
RESTful API with Express.js and MySQL for reliable data handling
Protected routes and secure sessions using JWT and cookies
Search and filtering for materials and discussion threads

projects.title: Restaurant Menu Display
projects.description: A remote digital signage system for restaurants that allows branch managers to control and schedule menu displays. Using a Raspberry Pi 3 connected to the in-store monitor, the device fetches menu assets (images/videos) and display schedules stored in Firebase. Managers can upload and manage menu content through a web dashboard, and the Raspberry Pi periodically syncs every 5 minutes, ensuring updated content even if the device was offline.

pages.heading: Project Overview
pages.text: A remote digital signage system for restaurants that allows branch managers to control and schedule menu displays. Using a Raspberry Pi 3 connected to the in-store monitor, the device fetches menu assets (images/videos) and display schedules stored in Firebase. Managers can upload and manage menu content through a web dashboard, and the Raspberry Pi periodically syncs every 5 minutes, ensuring updated content even if the device was offline.

pages.heading: The Challenge
pages.text: Before implementing the system, restaurants relied on a completely manual process for updating their digital menus. Branch managers sent image or video assets through WhatsApp or Google Drive, which staff then had to download, copy to a flash drive, and manually plug into the display. This workflow was slow, inconsistent, prone to mistakes, and prevented managers from scheduling menu content accurately.
list: Manual download and transfer of menu assets by staff
Flash drive dependency for updating the display
Time-consuming process that disrupted daily operations
No centralized system for managing assets across branches
Managers unable to schedule menu updates precisely
High risk of outdated or incorrect content being displayed

pages.heading: The Solution
pages.text: We delivered a centralized, automated digital signage system powered by Raspberry Pi and Firebase. Branch managers can now upload menu assets through a web dashboard, schedule when each item should be displayed, and manage content remotely. The Raspberry Pi updates itself every few minutes using scheduled tasks, eliminating manual work and ensuring the display always shows the correct content.
list: Web dashboard for uploading and managing menu assets
Centralized scheduling system with precise display timing
Raspberry Pi device connected directly to the restaurant monitor
Automatic content fetching from Firebase every five minutes
Full offline support—data remains cached even if the device is powered off
Reduced staff workload and ensured accurate menu displays

contributions.label: Frontend
tasks: Developed a web dashboard using Vue.js for branch managers to upload menu assets such as images and videos
Implemented scheduling features to allow managers to set display times for each menu item
Built a clean and intuitive UI for managing assets, playlists, and display configurations
Integrated Firebase as the backend storage for menu data, schedules, and asset metadata

contributions.label: Device & Backend (Raspberry Pi)
tasks: Configured the Raspberry Pi 3 as the main display controller connected to the restaurant monitor
Developed Python scripts to fetch the latest menu data and schedules from Firebase every 5 minutes using cron jobs
Implemented offline-ready storage so updated assets remain accessible even if the device loses connection
Used LibVLC to render images and play video playlists smoothly on the digital signage screen
Created an automated synchronization system that applies new schedules and assets without manual intervention

pages.heading: Key Features
list: Remote menu management with real-time content updates
Asset upload system supporting images and videos
Flexible scheduling to control when specific menus are displayed
Automatic Raspberry Pi sync every 5 minutes via Firebase
Offline-ready playback — Raspberry Pi stores and plays content even without internet
Web dashboard for branch managers to manage menus and schedules
Smooth media playback using LibVLC for stability and performance
Centralized data handling to reduce manual staff workload
